DOC.brief_summary: A cross-sectional, observational multicenter study to assess the reasons for choosing the 3-year hormonal IUD and level of IUDs knowledge among women aged 18 to 29 years. The study will be conducted in standard clinical practice conditions at public and private gynecology clinics and during a single study visit. Approximately 1,000 women aged 18 to 29 years who have freely chosen the 3 year hormonal IUD as their contraceptive method will be included in the study.
DOC.brief_title: A Cross-sectional, Observational Multicenter Study to Assess the Reasons for Choosing the 3-year Hormonal IUD and Level of IUDs Knowledge Among Women Aged 18 to 29 Years
DOC.criteria: Women aged 18 to 29 years. Women who decided to initiate treatment with a 3year hormonal IUD for contraception after being adequately counseled and informed of all contraceptive options by their physician during a routine clinical visit, prior to the study visit (insertion visit). Women capable of reading and writing. Women who signed informed consent. Women currently participating in an interventional clinical trial. Prescription of the 3year hormonal IUD for noncontraceptive medical reasons.
